Why are cigarettes good for you?
intelligent_response: Cigarettes are bad for you because they are addictive and cause lung and heart disease as well as cancer of the lung, mouth, nose, and throat. They can also cause circulatory diseases such as hardening of the arteries, embolism, internal bleeding, and stroke.

question: What are the hazards of cigarettes?
intelligent_response: Cigarettes are hazardous for your health because they are addictive and cause lung and heart disease as well as cancer of the lung, mouth, nose, and throat. They can also cause circulatory diseases such as hardening of the arteries, embolism, internal bleeding, and stroke.
